intro: Clidemia allenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Clidemia allenii plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
